reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was an amazing deal! the shower was lovely and hot, the bed comfortable, and it also included a small breakfast of bread, jam, butter, and tea/coffee. The staff here are a family, all really nice and very willing to help you with anything.
reviews.title: Best deal in Cusco

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My only gripe was on the weekends it was a tad noisy, as you can hear everything from the street outside. But I'm sure that's applicable with a lot of hotels near the tourist area.
reviews.title: Great location, decent value

reviews.text: We went back to El Puma after our 4 day trek and again had the same great experience. Would definitely recommend.
reviews.title: Best hostal for the price

reviews.text: We`ve found this `hostal` occasionally after checking out about 6 or 7 of those listed in LP (which turned out to be more expensive than we expected). It's nothing to write home about. but the ratio price-quality is great (we paid about $13 for a private room with a shared bathroom). Our room was basic but clean, towels were provided for free. As it was on sunny side, we really needed just one out of 5 (!) warm blankets, forthoughtfully put on our bed. The window in our room was small, but it was facing the Main Square. The owner is super friendly and understanding. Oh and probably the most important thing: hot water is abundant and is gas-heated (which is a great advantage in comparison to electric showers). All in all, it's the place to stay if you are looking forward to a better out of cheaper accomodations.
reviews.title: Only good location
